page.title: 04TRADITIONAL FARMING PULHAM
page.content: On some farms goats,donkeys,ponies & house cows are kept,1 farm breeds Suffolk Punches.There are still many barnyard poultry roaming freely.Free range eggs are in great demand,but these fowls are not just kept for profit,they are almost part of the family.Often they have names like 'the Mandarin'&'Esmerelda',a Chinese gander & his wife,she is over 25 yrs old & hasn't laid an egg for years,but they enjoy a happy retirement on a small farm that has become a wildlife sanctuary & a home for unwanted livestock.There are old meadows,lots of trees,hedges & ponds where everything can enjoy as natural a life as possible.Very little spraying or mechanical hedge trimming is allowed. Economically it may be crazy but it does help to balance modern farming methods.
